column4: After searching, I wondered if anyone could point me to a replacement for WinISO in Linux.
any good .iso file manipulation apps for windows besides "mount"
what do you want to do with it
I can use rar for most of my iso's, but for some they don't work.  I am just trying to view/extract
I used to use WinISO and MagicISO in Windows.  Now that I've migrated to Linux, I am in need of an ISO utility app
I don't know what those things do.  what are you trying to do.
oh.  well then, pretty much you mount them and treat them like any other (read-only) filesystem.
I have tried to unmount using sudo umount -a in the non mounted directory but to no avail, i get a device busy error
not -a!  that tries to umount all your filesystems! just sudo umount /where/you/mounted/the/iso
still keep getting device is busy....I have it mounted in ~/Desktop/new....I am running shell at /
you don't have anything open that could be using it?  try lsof | grep Desktop/new
got it to unmount thank you again.....any idea why 7907 is coming up when i mount it
thank you for your services sir/mam!
